data.title: Dan Brown Interview
data.meta_description: The Da Vinci Code author Dan Brown talks about his debut novel Digital Fortress in this interview. He also discusses teaching, cryptography, the NSA, privacy and more.
data.text: "The government knows far more about us than we could ever imagine. It is important, however, that we don't react with too much paranoia; agencies like the NSA are far more interested in terrorists than in the average citizen." "I'm far more of a romantic than I am a political espionage junkie. Romance (particularly lovers separated by insurmountable obstacles) always makes me care more about the characters and therefore the action."
